post: In the 19th Century fundamentalist supported the idea that new species appear abruptly, Catastrophism. Then Charles Darwin came along with his theory of Natural Selection and "proved" that new species evolve gradually. But it wasn't true. The fossil record shows no change for a long periods of time, then abruptly new species appeared. In 1972 scientist began calling this Punctuated Equilibrium. But Punctuated Equilibrium was nothing but a 20th Century version of Catastrophism. The fundamentalist had been right and Darwin had been wrong!
gpt3.5_cot_target_tg_plus_sd_expl: The target of the text is to discuss the debate between two theories of evolution - gradualism and punctuated equilibrium. It highlights the historical perspective of how the idea of new species appearing abruptly (Catastrophism) was initially supported by fundamentalists in the 19th century. It then introduces Charles Darwin's theory of Natural Selection, which proposed that new species evolve gradually. The text goes on to argue that the fossil record shows long periods of no change followed by abrupt appearances of new species,
gpt3.5_cot_target_tg_plus_sd: Evolutionary debate between gradualism and punctuated equilibrium.
